modules.description: This module defines a list of character-expression patterns and converts them into parsing rules for integer literals. It processes character-based patterns to generate rules that produce corresponding expressions, specifically handling integer literal parsing. It is used to define custom integer literal syntax in OCaml code, such as supporting different numeric bases or formats directly in the language parser.

This module generates typed integer literals for specific bit widths (8, 16, 32, 64, 128) as AST expressions, handling both signed and unsigned types. It operates on location information to embed literals directly into OCaml syntax trees. Useful for implementing custom integer literal syntax extensions in OCaml parsers.

This module processes integer literals in OCaml code by transforming them into typed values using AST rewriters, enabling custom parsing and strict size enforcement. It leverages character-expression patterns to define parsing rules and generates typed integer literals for specific bit widths, supporting both signed and unsigned formats. Operations include converting character-based syntax into expressions and embedding literals directly into the AST with precise location tracking. Example uses include extending OCaml's parser to support domain-specific numeric formats or fixed-size integer literals.
